original_title: How to survive rip currents and other drowning hazards, as Hurricane Erin approaches | CNN
article_summary: Hurricane Erin brings dangerous water conditions, including rip currents. A 2017 incident involving Wyatt Werneth, an experienced lifeguard instructor, highlights the urgency of knowing how to respond if caught in a rip current. Drowning is a significant concern, with an average of 11 deaths per day in the U.S., and prevention is crucial, especially for children, males, minority groups, and those with seizure disorders.</s>
